  • Uses of Position in chess

    Fields in chess declared as Position 
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    Position Piece.pos
    The Piece's position for it's location on the board Matches the Board's layout's yth xth indexical reference for the Piece.
    Methods in chess with parameters of type Position 
    Modifier and Type Method Description
    boolean Piece.collisionAt​(Position p)
    collisionAt Method Checks a Piece is located at the provided position.
    boolean Piece.enemyAt​(Position p)
    enemyAt Method Checks an enemy of this Piece is located at the provided position.
    boolean Board.EnemyCanAttack​(int s, Position p)
    EnemyCanAttackMethod This method determines if the enemy side can capture at a specific position on the Board.
    boolean Piece.friendAt​(Position p)
    enemyAt Method Checks an same-side piece (relative to this Piece) is located at the provided position.
    Piece Board.getPiece​(Position p)
    getPiece Method Responsible for updating the position member of each Piece after the moveTo method is called, to match that of this Board's Piece layout.
    int Board.movePiece​(Position p, Position np, Piece prom, int s)
    movePiece Method This method is responsible enacting a player's move by calling for the piece at position p to move to position np.
    abstract void Piece.moveTo​(Position newpos, Piece promotion)
    Abstract moveTo Method For each Piece implementation: Performs various legality checks on requested movement.
    boolean Board.noCollisions​(Position p1, Position p2)
    noCollisions Method Determines if there are no pieces located between two linearly separated positions on the board.
    void Board.setPiece​(Position p, Piece pic)
    setPiece Method Responsible for setting the setting the positional index p of this Board's layout to be a reference to Piece pic.
